thread.title: Tennessee basketball still fighting flu bug
thread.title_full: Tennessee basketball still fighting flu bug

title: Tennessee basketball still fighting flu bug
text:
Tennessee basketball still fighting flu bug Freshman guard Jordan Bowden still out sick for Vols Slot to Tennessee Links (Photo: Tennessee athletics, UTSports.com) 
Tennessee basketball is still fighting the flu bug as it enters the final two weeks of the regular season. 
"We just need to get everyone back healthy," Tennessee coach Rick Barnes said on Monday. "We've been hit by that flu bug like probably most teams. Hopefully we can get everyone back." 
The Vols (15-12, 7-7 SEC) host Vanderbilt (14-13, 7-7) on Wednesday (TV: SEC Network, 6:30 p.m.) and travel to No. 21 South Carolina (20-7, 10-4) on Saturday. 
"We're not clear right now," Barnes said of his team. "Jordan Bowden is still sick." 
(Want the latest scoop on Tennessee football and basketball? Make sure you're in the loop â€” take five seconds to sign up for our FREE Vols newsletter now!) 
Bowden started in Saturday's 90-70 win over Missouri, but played only one minute before checking out of the game and never returning. Bowden health is still day-to-day. 
"We don't know where he is and won't know for a day or two," Barnes said. "He was really sick and wanted to try to play the other night, couldn't do it." 
Sophomore guard Shembari Phillips scored 10 points in 28 minutes against Mizzou, filling the void left by Bowden. 
"It feels like (all the players) have had something with it," Barnes said. "(Bowden is) the last one, I think, that's dealt with it. He seems to have had it the worst, he and Jalen Johnson."
